intro: Ceruana rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf ceruana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are round or ovate, often with a slightly hairy surface. Ceruana rotundifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
